cnd21:48.1: "Like an elephant (nāga; also meaning a noble person) after giving up the herd":
cnd21:48.2: The elephant is called the elephant, and the one who is enlightened alone is
cnd21:48.3: also the elephant. For what reason is the alone-enlightened person an elephant?
cnd21:48.4: "Don't commit a crime" is the elephant; "don't go" is the elephant; "don't come"
cnd21:48.5: is the elephant. How is the alone-enlightened person "not committing crimes" as
cnd21:48.6: an elephant? Crimes are called evil and unwholesome dhammas: those that are
cnd21:48.7: polluted, that there are again (re-existing), there are fears, those that suffer
cnd21:48.8: the consequences, and the ones that will die in the future.
cnd21:49.1: "Do not commit any crimes in the world,
cnd21:49.2: After leaving all bonds and bondages,
cnd21:49.3: Those who don't stick to everything and are free,
cnd21:49.4: Like this are truly called elephants."
cnd21:50.1: How is the alone-enlightened person "not going" as an elephant? The one
cnd21:50.2: enlightened one shouldn't do what he doesn't want to do; what he doesn't want to
cnd21:50.3: do is not what he should do; he who doesn't go because of obsession should not
cnd21:50.4: do what he should; don't go with anger; don't go because of ignorance; don't go
cnd21:50.5: because of conceit; don't go because of seeing; don't go because of abandonment;
cnd21:50.6: don't go because of doubt; don't go because of potential troubles; don't be
cnd21:50.7: carried by quarrels, taken away, and moved.
cnd21:51.1: How is the alone-enlightened person "not coming" as elephant? Any pollution that
cnd21:51.2: is cut off by the Sotāpanna Path, those pollution he no longer experiences, does
cnd21:51.3: not return, and does not go back; it is said that... (omitted) is not
cnd21:51.4: returned... (omitted); all that pollution is cut off by the Arahant Path, he
cnd21:51.5: will no longer experience, return, or go back to those pollutions.

cnd21:52.2: gives up and avoids the herd, it enters the woods, walks, lives, moves, goes on,
cnd21:52.3: guards, and survives. Those who are alone in enlightenment also give up and
cnd21:52.4: avoid the masses, and then they use the woods, wild forests, and border

cnd21:52.7: alone, enters the village alone for alms, advances alone, returns alone, sits
cnd21:52.8: alone in a quiet place, performs alone, walks, lives alone, acts, goes on,
